    • Field Summary

      Properties Defined Constraints Value
      BasedOn

      The proposal, order, or plan that is partly or wholly fulfilled by this item.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      BasedOn
      0..*
      Category

      The general type or class of this item.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      Category
      0..1
      RelevantTime

      The time or time period that the statement addresses. The clinically relevant time is not necessarily when the information is gathered or when a test is carried out, but for example, when a specimen was collected, or the time period referred to by the question. Use a TimePeriod for a measurement or specimen collection continued over a significant period of time (e.g. 24 hour Urine Sodium).
      DataType
      Cardinality
      RelevantTime
      0..1
      DiagnosticReportPerformer

      The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      DiagnosticReportPerformer
      0..1
      ResultsInterpreter

      The practitioner or organization that is responsible for the report's conclusions and interpretations.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ResultsInterpreter
      0..1
      Specimen

      A specimen is a substance, physical object, or collection of objects, that the laboratory considers a single discrete, uniquely identified unit that is the subject of one or more steps in the laboratory workflow. A specimen may include multiple physical pieces as long as they are considered a single unit within the laboratory workflow. A specimen results from one to many specimen collection procedures, and may be contained in multiple specimen containers. Specimen may have one or more processing activities.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ref(Specimen)
      0..*
      Observation

      Represents the result of evaluations (measurements, tests, or questions) that have been performed. Observation has a value representing the result (answer), or an DataAbsentReason indicating why the value is not present. Things observed about the subject can include social and behavioral factors, subjective and objective observations, and assessments. For an Observation, the Code describes the aspect or property of the subject being observed or measured. The Code is the 'question code' that pairs to the 'answer' contained in the Value.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ref(Observation)
      0..*
      MediaIncluded

      A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).
      DataType
      Cardinality
      MediaIncluded
      0..*
      ConclusionText

      Concise and clinically contextualized impression / summary of the diagnostic report.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ConclusionText
      0..1
      ConclusionCode

      One or more codes that represent the summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ConclusionCode
      0..*
      PresentedForm

      Fully formatted representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      PresentedForm
      0..*
